means: <经>制止通货膨胀，通货紧缩（政策）

sentence.Network_en: This suggests that disinflation is proceeding rapidly.
sentence.Network_cn: 这说明通货紧缩在快速进行着.

sentence.Network_en: At the same time, disinflation makes it cheaper to borrow in both real and nominal terms.
sentence.Network_cn: 与此同时, 无论是以实际还是名义价值衡量,反通货膨胀都令借贷成本更低廉.

sentence.Network_en: Money held by households and firms is contracting - a harbinger of disinflation and slump.
sentence.Network_cn: 家庭和商户所持有的现金在缩水,这预示着通货紧缩和经济萧条.

entry.def: Disinflation is a reduction in the rate of inflation, especially as a result of government policies.

means.word_mean: 1. a reduction of prices intended to improve the balance of payments

auth_sentence.content: Bullard said he believes the disinflation trend has bottomed.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bullard said he believes the disinflation trend has bottomed.

auth_sentence.content: Similarly, disinflation is normally a good thing -- a steep fall in inflation to a low, relaxing level.
